## How this works


    This package serve the aim to convert temperature between fahrenheit and celsius degree, and provide reference on melting points of 10 kinds of common metal: 

    It contains 12 functions:

    2 of them is temperature converting functions: 'c_to_f()', converting celsius to fahrenheit, and 'f_to_c()', converting fahrenheit to celsius, pretty self explanatory.

    The rest 10 functions provide melting point of 10 kinds of metal: gold, silver, coper, zinc, iron, magnesium, tin, titanium, lead and aluminum. The function takes an argument of either "f" or "c", standing for fahrenheit and celsius seperatly.Example: 

```{r}
library(ConvertTemp)

goldmelt('f')
goldmelt('c')

print(paste("Today's temperature is", c_to_f(18), 'Fahrenheit.'))
```
